intro: Aster ottomanum, commonly known as the Ottoman aster, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces showy, daisy-like flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes. Aster ottomanum is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
